oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Higher antioxidant content in organic milk than in conventional milk due to feeding strategy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nielsen, Jacob Holm
Lund-Nielsen, Tina
Skibsted, Leif
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Over recent years, several studies have shown that differences in the composition of organic and conventional milk are either small or non-existent. However, a new study, made by the Danish Institute of Agricultural Sciences and the Royal Veterinary and Agricultural University, shows that the content of antioxidants is significantly higher in organic milk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nielsen, Jacob Holm; Lund-Nielsen, Tina and Skibsted, Leif (2004) Higher antioxidant content in organic milk than in conventional milk due to feeding strategy. . Online at <http://www.darcof.dk/enews/sep04/milk.html <http://www.darcof.dk/enews/sep04/milk.html>>.
